title: Immport basic_study_design template schema
description: Immport basic_study_design template schema autogenerated by the CEDAR Template Editor

_ui.title: ImmPort basic_study_design
_ui.description: The basic study design template defines and annotates key elements of a study including the purpose, subject grouping, schedule of events, personnel, and references (weblinks, publications). Use the basic_study_design_optional template to add additional information for a study after a study is defined in ImmPort. The basic study design template consists of several sections or compound templates. Some compound templates are required (e.g. study, arm_or_cohort) and other compound templates are optional (e.g. (study_pubmed)).

_ui.title: User_Def_Study_ID
_ui.description: The study user defined ID is an identifier chosen by the data provider to refer to a study design. This ID may be referenced by other data records (e.g. arm). The user defined ID is not shared.

_ui.title: Brief_Title
_ui.description: The brief title will be displayed on ImmPort wherever the study is described.

_ui.title: Official_Title
_ui.description: The official study title is displayed on the ImmPort study detail page.

_ui.title: Study_Type
_ui.description: The study types are adapted from Clinicaltrials.gov terms.

_ui.title: Brief_Description
_ui.description: A brief study description highlights the essential features of a study.

_ui.title: Detailed_Description
_ui.description: The detailed description can be formatted with html tags to improve legibility. Embedded new line characters should be removed.

_ui.title: Hypothesis
_ui.description: The hypothesis can be formatted with html tags to improve legibility. Embedded new line characters should be removed.

_ui.title: Objectives
_ui.description: The objectives can be formatted with html tags to improve legibility. Embedded new line characters should be removed.

_ui.title: Endpoints
_ui.description: The endpoints can be formatted with html tags to improve legibility. Embedded new line characters should be removed.

_ui.title: Sponsoring_Organization
_ui.description: The organization that provides funding and support for the study.

_ui.title: Target_Enrollment
_ui.description: The number of subjects proposed to be enrolled in the study.

_ui.title: Condition_Studied
_ui.description: A short description of what is being researched or evaluated in the study (e.g. influenza).

_ui.title: Minimum_Age
_ui.description: The minimum age of subjects enrolled in the study.

_ui.title: Maximum_Age
_ui.description: The maximum age of subjects enrolled in the study.

_ui.title: Age_Unit
_ui.description: The unit of time used to describe the subject's age in the study.

_ui.title: Actual_Start_Date
_ui.description: The date format is dd-MMM-yyyy where day (dd) is one or two digits 1..31 appropriate to the month, month (MMM) is case-insensitive value (Jan, Feb, Mar, Apr, May, Jun, Jul, Aug, Sep, Oct, Nov, Dec), and year (yyyy) is four digit year, for example 2005.

_ui.title: Intervention_Agent
_ui.description: If a study is interventional or has an interventional component, a short descriptive name of the intervention agent is requested.

_ui.title: User_Def_Arm_Or_Cohort_ID
_ui.description: The study's arm(s) or cohort(s) group subjects by criteria relevant to the study (e.g. age, condition) and/or treatments or interventions. Insert rows in the template to define additional arms or cohorts linked to the study. Use the basic_study_design_optional template to add additional records after a study is defined in ImmPort.

_ui.title: Name
_ui.description: The arm or cohort name is not referenced by other data records.

_ui.title: Description
_ui.description: The description should expand any abbreviations used in the arm or cohort name. For example for an observational study with a cohort whose name was 'ADEH+', the description would be 'Atopic dermatitis with eczema herpeticum'.

_ui.title: Population_Selection_Rule
_ui.description: For an observational study the rule may either be 'Subjects selected by phenotypic characteristics', or the selection rule can provide additional information about population characteristics unique to the cohort. For an interventional study with the populations chosen by randomization the randomization rule should be specified (e.g. 'randomized (1:1:1:1) to four treatment groups'). For an interventional study using rules other randomization these rules should be stated (e.g. 'Selected by physician').

_ui.title: Sort_Order
_ui.description: Use this field to indicate if there is a preferred sort order of arms or cohorts. The contents of the field should be a positive whole number. Larger numbers are displayed later in Arm or Cohort lists.

_ui.title: Type
_ui.description: For an interventional study, the type defines the treatment/control attributes of the arms. The attributes are selected from the values listed below (a study may have more than one arm of a given value). Clinical studies often use the following terms. Experimental - Arm for procedure or drug being evaluated. Active Comparator - arm receiving 'standard of care' treatment. Placebo Comparator - arm receiving placebo treatment. Sham Comparator - arm receiving a sham procedure such as a surgery or a sham device. No Intervention - arm receiving neither 'standard of care' treatment a placebo, or sham procedure or device. For an observational study, the type should be Observational - All arms are observing differences in cohorts

_ui.title: User_Def_Study_Personnel_ID
_ui.description: The personnel user defined ID is an identifier chosen by the data provider to refer to personnel who may be contacted for more details about the study document. If more than one study personnel record is to be defined, copy the block of rows from User_Def_Study_Personnel_ID to Site_Name for each additional study personnel record. Use the basic_study_design_optional template to add additional records after a study is defined in ImmPort.

_ui.title: Honorific
_ui.description: Usually, the education achievement level of the person.

_ui.title: Last_Name
_ui.description: The last name of the study personnel being described.

_ui.title: First_Name
_ui.description: The first name of the study personnel being described.

_ui.title: Suffixes
_ui.description: Suffixes that are part of the study personnel's name being described.

_ui.title: Organization
_ui.description: The organization with whom the study personnel being described is affiliated.

_ui.title: Email
_ui.description: Contact information of the study personnel being described.

_ui.title: Title_In_Study
_ui.description: The role the personnel play in the study as defined by the research team.

_ui.title: Role_In_Study
_ui.description: The ImmPort display will show the personnel listed as 'PI' in the study.

_ui.title: Site_Name
_ui.description: Enter the site name if there is a need to further differentiate the affiliation of the study personnel form the Organization.

_ui.title: User_Def_Period_ID
_ui.description: The period user defined ID is an identifier chosen by the data provider to refer to a period within the study. This ID may be referenced by other data records (e.g. planned visit). The user defined ID is not shared. In many non-human research studies, there is a single period that spans the duration of the study. Insert rows in the template to define additional periods linked to the study. Use the basic_study_design_optional template to add additional records after a study is defined in ImmPort.

_ui.title: Title
_ui.description: The period title is not referenced by other data records.

_ui.title: Order_Number
_ui.description: This is a positive whole number value.

_ui.title: User_Def_Planned_Visit_ID
_ui.description: The planned visit user defined ID is an identifier chosen by the data provider to refer to a planned visit. This ID may be referenced by other data records (e.g. biological samples). The user defined ID is not shared. Insert rows in the template to define additional planned visits linked to the study. Use the basic_study_design_optional template to add additional records after a study is defined in ImmPort.

_ui.title: Visit_Name
_ui.description: the visit name should indicate the purpose of the visit (e.g. screening, assessment, inoculation, sample drawn). The visit name is not referenced by other data records.

_ui.title: Visit_Order_Number
_ui.description: This is a positive whole number value.

_ui.title: User_Def_Period_ID
_ui.description: The user defined period ID in planned visit should be an exact match to the period ID in the 'period' block of the study design.

_ui.title: Min_Start_Day
_ui.description: This is a positive or negative numeric value.

_ui.title: Max_Start_Day
_ui.description: This is a positive or negative numeric value. If no value is entered, the maximum start day will be set equal to the minimum start day.

_ui.title: Start_Rule
_ui.description: Enter a start rule only if it is more interesting than 'subject has arrived for a scheduled visit'.

_ui.title: End_Rule
_ui.description: Enter an end rule only if it is more interesting than 'subject has arrived for a scheduled visit'.

_ui.title: User_Def_Criterion_ID
_ui.description: The inclusion or exclusion user defined ID is an identifier chosen by the data provider to refer to a criterion used to determine whether a subject may be enrolled in a study. Use the basic_study_design_optional template to add additional records after a study is defined in ImmPort.

_ui.title: Criterion
_ui.description: One or more criterion must be described to decide whether a subject may be enrolled in a study.

_ui.title: Criterion_Category
_ui.description: The criterion category is selected form a preferred list of terms.

_ui.title: File_Name
_ui.description: If there are additional files (e.g. as data dictionaries, CRFs, custom formatted lab tests or assessments) that should be linked to the study please indicate them in this block. Insert rows in the template to link additional files to the study. Use the basic_study_design_optional template to add additional records after a study is defined in ImmPort. The file size name limit is 250 characters. For a given study, all file names for study_file must be unique.

_ui.title: Description
_ui.description: A brief description of the file.

_ui.title: Study_File_Type
_ui.description: Additional study data or study descriptions are current preferred terms.

_ui.title: Link_Name
_ui.description: The name of the website to which the link refers. Use the basic_study_design_optional template to add additional records after a study is defined in ImmPort.

_ui.title: Link_Value
_ui.description: If this is a clinical trial, please include the clinicalTrial.gov URL.

_ui.title: Pubmed_ID
_ui.description: The Pubmed or PubMedCentral identifier of an article that includes data from this study. Use the basic_study_design_optional template to add additional records after a study is defined in ImmPort.

_ui.title: Pubmed_Title
_ui.description: The title of an article that includes data from this study.

_ui.title: Journal
_ui.description: The journal name that publishes an article that includes data from this study.

_ui.title: Year
_ui.description: The article publication year.

_ui.title: Month
_ui.description: The article publication month.

_ui.title: Issue
_ui.description: The journal's issue number.

_ui.title: Pages
_ui.description: The journal's page number.

_ui.title: Authors
_ui.description: The article's authors.

_ui.title: User_Def_Prot_ID
_ui.description: The protocol ID for the study. Use the basic_study_design_optional template to add additional records after a study is defined in ImmPort.
